summary: This is an email chain from August 10, 2019, discussing the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. The correspondence indicates the Bureau (FBI) is investigating per the Attorney General's order, and there is a deliberate effort to keep the District Attorney's Office of New York (DANY) from involvement at that time.

events.title: Investigation into Epstein's Death
events.description: Email correspondence reveals the Bureau (FBI) is actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's death per the order of the Attorney General, and a decision is made to not involve the District Attorney's Office of New York (DANY) at that time.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 10, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his jail cell.
The Bureau (FBI) is confirmed to be investigating Epstein's death per the order of the Attorney General.
There is a stated intention to keep the District Attorney's Office of New York (DANY) from having anything to do with the investigation at that moment.
The head of the Homicide Unit at DANY had inquired whether their office was looking into the death, indicating initial jurisdictional interest.
